channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Faded line, 28th September
item.description:
The road lines on the roundabout are severely faded in some parts and barely visible at all. The worst parts are by the Cheltenham Rd and Churchdown junctions, but honestly, the lines on the whole roundabout could really do with a fresh lick of paint so you can actually see them clearly!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elm Bridge Court, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe home shaking for years, 28th September
item.description:
Severn Trent's manhole cover located outside 156 London Road, in the road, is causing severe shaking of properties as lorries pass through them, all day and night. After years they finally 'fixed' them, which lasted 2 months. The home shaking has returned along with a loud 'CLANK CLANK' from every vehicle passing through. This issue is exacerbated at night by lorries speeding due to empty roads, drastically increasing the force created as they essentially drop into a hole then hit the edge. Longterm sleep deprivation is very destructive to mental health, please could you help oversee it being fixed properly so we can have quiet enjoymen of our homes? Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 129 London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tip, 28th September
item.description:
From passing it looks like there are at least two fridge/freezers and a pile of black bags. Sorry for lack of info, it’s hard to slow on a roundabout.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Brockworth Roundabout, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Breach of Restricted Covenant, 28th September
item.description:
Caravan parked in breach of restricted covenant, also obscures view around corner for residents and drivers and ourselves. No permission obtained.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 23 Berkeley Close, Hucclecote

item.title: Flytip of Plastic filled bags, 26th September
item.description:
The location is the top of Aggs Hill about half way until the road is designated Cotswold Way. The tip is on the Right Hand side going towards the Burnt Oak Crossroads but before the wooded part where there is a Field Gate which is also a passing place on the road. Please can these be cleared up as they have been there for a few days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
